title: Notable & Quotable: Which American Way?
sub_head: ‘Three characteristics that have endured from the founding are a live-and-let-live attitude, a belief in opportunity and initiative, and a strong sense of patriotism.’
body: The Hudson Institute’s Christopher DeMuth in an interview with Lénárd Sándor of the Institute for American Studies at Hungary’s National University of Public Service, appearing in Mandiner magazine, Oct. 7:
